mods.abstract: $100 REWARD. RANAWAY or stolen from the plantation, known as Hutchinson's Magnolio plantation, situated on Red River, Caddo parish, about the 9th of September, the negro boy Charles, aged 14 years about 4 feet, 10 inches high, weighs about 100 lbs., and of black complexion. The above reward of One Hundred Dollars will be paid for the delivery of the negro and the arrest with evidence to convict the person who stole him; or Fifty Dollars for the delivery of the negro to me, or his confinement in the Shreveport jail, or Twenty-five Dolalrs, for his confinement in any jail, notifying me of the same. JOSEPH J. GILBERT. Knox Point, Bossier parish, La., Dec. 19, 1860. *Constitutional, Alexandria, La., copy four times and send bill to this office for collection.
mods.note: Louisiana State University Libraries, Special Collections ( http://www.lib.lsu.edu/special )
mods.accessCondition: E-mail lsudiglib@lsu.edu with questions or comments about the collection.

Physical rights are retained by the LSU Libraries. Copyright has expired and the item is therefore in the public domain. Permission to reproduce this image must be requested through the Special Collections Department, Louisiana State University Libraries.
mods.note: Louisiana Runaway Slave Advertisements, 1836-1865, Louisiana Digital Library, Baton Rouge, La.
